image.altText: Handcuffed prisoner being led in corridor by warden.

props.synopsis: Stories of abuse and neglect from the notorious Ashley Youth Detention Centre in Tasmania were heard throughout a Commission of Inquiry. It remains open — but will the state election change that?

title.children: Ashley was called a 'war zone' – but will either major party shut it down?

image.altText: A few ambulances lined up at the bottom of a ramp at a hosptial.

props.synopsis: The Liberal government faced extensive scrutiny over hospital ramping, and now health spokesperson Guy Barnett believes he can end the problem. But doctors have sounded the alarm straight away.

title.children: Medical professionals say Tasmanian Liberals plan to 'ban' ambulance ramping won't work

image.altText: Line art of a shopping cart, canned food, coins and a budget sticker on a colourful background

props.synopsis: More than 900 Australians shared how the growing pressure of cost of living expenses are changing how, what and when they eat. Here is what they said.

title.children: Dumpster diving, eating left-overs, skipping meals: Here's how hundreds of Australians say they're coping with food prices

image.altText: Donald Trump

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court hands Donald Trump a major victory, ruling he cannot be disqualified from running for president under a constitutional clause referencing insurrection.

title.children: Donald Trump wins US Supreme Court fight to remain on ballots ahead of Super Tuesday primaries

image.altText: An elderly man with white hair in a suit points as he speaks into a microphone in front of a large American flag backdrop.

props.synopsis: Democrats and Republicans in 15 states and one US territory will cast their ballots (or caucus) for their choice of presidential candidate on Tuesday. Here's what to look for — and what's at stake.

title.children: What is Super Tuesday? Your guide to the US primary gauntlet that can make or break a presidential candidate

image.altText: A boy, whose face is not shown, wearing a Cranbrook School blazer and tie, with a backpack over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: As one of the most exclusive boys' schools prepares to go co-ed, women who worked there warn its culture is toxic and needs to change.

title.children: Women who worked at one of Australia's most exclusive boys' schools warn its culture is toxic

image.altText: An older Indigenous man with a backdrop of newspaper clippings from the early 90s.

props.synopsis: Terry Irving was imprisoned for a crime he didn't commit. Now the justice system will be asked to answer the ultimate question: what's the cost of loss of liberty?

title.children: Terry was jailed for a crime he didn't commit. After 30 years, he'll finally learn the price of freedom

image.altText: Two small children are sitting on a couch in colourful pajamas, watching cartoons on their tablets.

props.synopsis: Toddlers who get more screen time could be learning fewer new words, an Australian study finds, warning parents of the opportunity cost of distracting children with devices.

title.children: How much does screen time cost a toddler? A new study says more than 1,000 words a day

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing a jacket and collared shirt smiles for a portrait.

props.synopsis: After a meeting lasting almost two and a half hours, Simon Kennedy defeats three other Liberal Party candidates to win preselection in former prime minister Scott Morrison's old seat of Cook.

title.children: Liberals choose former McKinsey consultant to contest Morrison's former seat of Cook

image.altText: New houses sit on a hillside in a housing estate at Albion Park.

props.synopsis: There is further evidence Australia's ongoing housing crisis is deepening as the national vacancy rate hits a record low of 0.7 per cent, according to Domain.

title.children: Extreme conditions for renters described as 'needle in a haystack type stuff' as housing crisis deepens

image.altText: A large structure with a slogan projected on to the side of it

props.synopsis: French MPs and senators enshrine the right to abortion in the country's constitution 780 votes to 72 in a move welcomed by women's rights groups as historic.

title.children: World first as France puts right to abortion in constitution

image.altText: A man sits at a desk.

props.synopsis: ASIC is alleging Dave Hodgson and two of his companies provided unlicensed financial services and made misrepresentations to investors. Mr Hodgson, who is the proponent behind what he claims would be a "clean" coal-to-hydrogen project in Tasmania says he will "mount a very strong defence".

title.children: 'They crucified Jesus, now us': Supporters rally around businessman being sued by ASIC

image.altText: Woman sits smiling, paling fence behind her.

props.synopsis: Feeling a strange sensation in one of her teeth, Elisse Kleiner went to the dentist. It marked the start of a cancer journey that would lead to surgery to remove half of her top jaw. A year on, the Tasmanian musician has returned to the stage.

title.children: What felt like a wobbly tooth turned into a cancer diagnosis for Elisse

image.altText: The Australian flag and a crucifix

props.synopsis: About a third of Victorian councils still open meetings with a Christian prayer, but at least one council has voted to ditch it after receiving a complaint claiming its inclusion violates the Victorian Human Rights and Responsibilities Charter.

title.children: Is the council meeting opening prayer a human rights violation?

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Volunteers have been desperately searching for missing mother Samantha Murphy but their efforts could unfortunately be hampering the police, a former detective tells 7.30.

title.children: Samantha Murphy search shifts to phone data as former detective warns volunteer searchers may be hurting police investigation

image.altText: People speak to a crowd next to Oxford Street.

props.synopsis: A friend of flight attendant Luke Davies says anti-police protesters have "hijacked a national tragedy" for their own cause following a demonstration that shut down a major intersection in Sydney on Friday night.

title.children: 'Hijacked a national tragedy': Friend of Luke Davies calls out anti-police protesters

image.altText: A man in a suit gestures while talking.

props.synopsis: Liberal MP Keith Wolohan says the party must "lift its game" on female representation, as another woman loses a preselection contest.

title.children: 'Work to do' on female candidates, says Liberal Party MP

image.altText: A man wearing a whote shirt.

props.synopsis: In the hopes of a prevailing peace in the South China Sea, the Philippines president says he wanted a Cold War-style hotline to Chinese leader Xi Jinping but has been denied.

title.children: Single 'mistake' could trigger South China Sea conflict, Marcos warns

image.altText: A composite of two images: Apple's logo on a glass wall, and Spotify's logo shown on a screen

props.synopsis: The European Commission levels its first antitrust penalty against Apple, which says it will challenge the bloc's decision in court and says there is no evidence its practices have harmed consumers.

title.children: Apple fined $3 billion by European Union over music streaming competition

image.altText: Camellia Aebischer poses on a balcony wearing a large backpack, ready to travel to Asia after taking time off work.

props.synopsis: Last year I was working a dream job, running a successful side hustle with my partner and had a core group of friends. It was also the year I booked the most sessions with a counsellor.

title.children: Why I decided to stop everything and take a gap year at 32

image.altText: A split image showing an older man and a younger man.

props.synopsis: A campsite believed to have been being used by the men was discovered in the Murchison region on the weekend.

title.children: Full-scale search for father and son prospectors underway in WA

image.altText: A waterspout over the ocean.

props.synopsis: Severe storms swept across south-east Queensland on Monday, with waterspouts forming north of Brisbane. So what are they and why do they form?

title.children: Queensland storms produce waterspouts that look like tornadoes

image.altText: Shane Drumgold out the front of the ACT courts.

props.synopsis: The ACT's former top prosecutor Shane Drumgold has succeeded in challenging some findings made against him in an inquiry into the prosecution of former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Former prosecutor succeeds in challenging inquiry findings into Bruce Lehrmann prosecution

image.altText: A woman standing at a podium raising her hand.

props.synopsis: The foreign minister warns that the region needs new diplomatic and legal mechanisms to head off the risk of catastrophic conflict as tensions rise in the South China Sea.

title.children: 'We face destabilising, provocative and coercive actions': Wong warns against conflict as tensions rise in South China Sea

image.altText: A woman sits on a park bench

props.synopsis: Professional basketballer Alex Bunton didn't know that what she was experiencing was abuse and struggled to reach out for help. New data shows many who find themselves in similar situations never escape.

title.children: Pro basketballer's domestic abuse started with love-bombing and financial control before it turned physical

image.altText: Sliced beetroot in front of a burger with beetroot on it.

props.synopsis: Australia's reliance on imports is being blamed for a national shortage of sliced beetroot that has been frustrating consumers for months.

title.children: Why your 'burger with the lot' hasn't included sliced beetroot for a while

image.altText: A close up of a copper and plastic IUD.

props.synopsis: Some of the 143 Inuit women — including many who were teenagers at the time — say they were not aware of what happened or did not consent to the intervention.

title.children: 'We cannot wait any longer': Indigenous women in Greenland sue Denmark over involuntary contraception

image.altText: Krystal and Anastasia Marshall hug and smile.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of murdering her ex-wife has been recorded on prison phone calls with her male co-accused discussing their need to "stick to the story" and to "pin it" on him, an Adelaide court has heard.

title.children: Prison calls recorded alleged murderers discussing case and 'where certain witnesses live'

image.altText: Two soccer teams play in an outdoor field half-covered with snow

props.synopsis: Australia snatched a 2-1 win over South Korea in their opening group game of the U20 Women's Asian Cup, with no help from about 15cm of snow that covered the field.

title.children: 'How is this OK?' AFC under fire for Young Matildas' snowy U20 Asian Cup pitch

image.altText: Min Wo

props.synopsis: One talented child in a family is exceptional. Two is extraordinary. Siblings Minjee and Min Woo Lee are both big stars on the golf circuit … but they couldn’t be more different.

title.children: The rebel and the rule follower: How Min Woo and Minjee Lee became superstar siblings
